timeline.bodyText: the config name (readWindowMs) is not self-identified. Can we have a more descriptive name (eg zookeeperReadWindowMs)?
timeline.author: cx-super

replies.bodyText: Thanks. Will rename this with the suggested name
replies.author: nizarm

replies.bodyText: @ChaoLinkedIn  - Refactored all the variable names to zookeeperReadWindowMs and updated the pull request branch with the commit
replies.author: nizarm

timeline.bodyText: So the delay is in the range of [midPoint, readWindowMs] -- why not [0, readWindowMs]? There is no need to explicitly add latency for the calls.
timeline.author: cx-super

replies.bodyText: The purpose of adding the delay is to reduce the number of reads as discussed in the design document. This will help us to reduce a lot of unwanted watch updates by delaying within the acceptable threshold. Please check the design document and let me know you still have concerns with this approach.
replies.author: nizarm

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the clarification. Reviewed the doc and agree there should be a delay.
replies.author: cx-super

timeline.message: Update the config parameters in LastSeenLoadBalancer

timeline.bodyText: any reason not to use Timespan? for easier tweaking in the future and better readability.
timeline.author: bohhyang

replies.bodyText: If you see the use of the read window in processWatch function - we are using this to randomize setting the watch. So we may not be able to leverage the TimeSpan here and it may introduce unwanted conversion back to int in processWatch to randomize.
replies.author: nizarm

replies.bodyText: could the function "getDurationInMilliseconds" in Timespan work for getting a long in milliseconds for the calculation?
replies.author: bohhyang

timeline.bodyText: just for my understanding, which config is this executor service coming from? where is it defined?
timeline.author: bohhyang

replies.bodyText: This is coming from R2SchedulerFactory in container
replies.author: nizarm
